definition: daydream/reverie
surname Bai

white/snowy/pure/bright/empty/blank/plain/clear/to make clear/in vain/gratuitous/free of charge/reactionary/anti-communist/funeral/to stare coldly/to write wrong character/to state/to explain/vernacular/spoken lines in opera
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
sun/day/date, day of the month
dream/CL:場|场[chang2],個|个[ge4]/(bound form) to dream

sentences.english: A Romanticist reading comic books under the tree, loves to be in a daydreaming.
sentences.chinese: 阿浪漫主義讀漫畫書的樹，喜歡在一個白日夢。

sentences.english: The young man was much given to daydreaming.
sentences.chinese: 這個年輕人老愛做白日夢。

sentences.english: When I was young I always daydreamed.
sentences.chinese: 我小時候經常做白日夢。

sentences.english: Sir , please don’t indulge yourself with idle daydreams. Take your time.
sentences.chinese: 先生，請您不要做白日夢，抓緊時間吧。

sentences.english: Professor Chang is a Walter Mitty about becoming the president of China.
sentences.chinese: 張教授愛做中國總統的白日夢，但他沒有領導的才能。

sentences.english: But forgive me for sharing my own private daydream.
sentences.chinese: 但原諒我要分享一下自己的白日夢。

sentences.english: He doesn't work at all. Instead he sips coffee and day-dreams.
sentences.chinese: 他根本就不工作，而是一邊喝咖啡一邊做白日夢。

sentences.english: Can you program daydreaming and spacing out in your day planner?
sentences.chinese: 你會允許白日夢而阻斷了你一天的計劃嗎？

sentences.english: The choice was clear -- abandon them, or his dreams.
sentences.chinese: 似乎是別無選擇了，拋棄他們，或者繼續做白日夢。

sentences.english: And daydreams shatter in your hand
sentences.chinese: 白日夢破滅在你自己手裏。

sentences.english: And build a cyber-sequel that’s not just a pipedream.
sentences.chinese: 建立一個網絡新時代現在看來不再只是一個白日夢。

sentences.english: I wanna make a day dream, but reality always knocks down the dream.
sentences.chinese: 我想做一個白日夢，可現實總是把夢擊碎。

sentences.english: Just then the bell rings and wakes him from his daydream.
sentences.chinese: 然後下課鈴響了把他從白日夢中喚醒回來。

sentences.english: Many students now often find themselves day-dreaming in class.
sentences.chinese: 現在許多學生常常發現自己上課時做白日夢。

definition: bored to death (idiom)/bored stiff/overcome with boredom
to indulge in flights of fancy (idiom)/to let one's imagination run wild
things like this (idiom); and so on/and the rest/etc
babbling nonsense (idiom); crazy and unfounded ravings/double Dutch
to be obsessive/to persist obstinately
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
not to have any meaning/meaningless
unrealistic/impractical
muddleheaded
imaginative/to have one's mind buzzing with ideas
dull/vapid/colorless
nightmare
to take a lot of trouble (over sb or sth)/may I trouble you (to do sth)
to be cynical/to be embittered
satisfied just to get through (idiom); to muddle through/without high ambitions, but getting by
to awaken/to come to realize/awakened to the truth/the truth dawns upon one/scales fall from the eyes/to become aware
